answers.answer: Sounds like you are pinching off a nerve in your low back.  Did the chiropractor try traction?  Since a chiropractor hasn't helped much, you may want to tryphysical therapy.

Hello.Your symptoms can be due to neuropathy. This could be a peripheral neuropathy. Common causes are diabetes, thyroid dysfunction and compression neuropathy.It will be a good idea to get it evaluated first. What you are trying now is a treatment option. This may not be an appropriate action. Please consult a neurologist and get yourself thoroughly examined.Regards

question: a week and a half ago I woke up with my right shin and foot numb, i thought it was going to go away during the day but it didn't. the next day i deciced to go to a chiropractor and he told me the problem was in my lower back. since that day I started going to the chiropractor 3 times a week. when i go there I receive a shocking therapy in my foot and shin, my foot and shin got a little bit better but they're atill numb. should i need to go to a neurologist to have another opinion? am I going to the wrong doctor now?
title: Numb Shin and Foot
